title: If you think SoloQ will mess up DynamicQ, let the community decide.
body:
Most of us are aware of the post from Riot put out yesterday concerning the status of Dynamic Que. The message everyone got from it quite easily is that Riot believes that releasing solo que will complicate the glaring issues that dynamic que has shown us it posseses.

If that is the case, release Solo Que and let the people who play the game decide what is best.

If Dynamic Que dies out as a result of everyone going for the pure solo que we were promised _twice_ and have been asking for for ages, then so be it. Let the people who put money in your pockets, spend time playing your game, and the people who bother spending their time on these boards in hopes of improving the game show you with numbers which que is the right one to invest time into.

Release Solo que and if Dynamic dies out, then let that be the case instead of you sitting there biting your fingernails at the "whatif" scenario of realizing dynamic que was a failure.

Edit 1: Link to Redmercy's video and thoughts on solo que. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ahItzHevJxM)]

Edit 2: Link to a fellow board's member who broke down what likely caued Riot to implement DynamicQ and handle SoloQ in the manner it has been done. This post is mostly for skeptics, and if this post doesnt knock sense into you, quite frankly nothing will. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/5E4pnUW5-why-there-will-never-be-a-ranked-solo-queue

Macromite is right to a degree but I have something of a different persuasion to add. 

Solo Queue more than likely isn't going to kill off Dynamic Queue, there are a ton of people who really like it despite the much louder group on the boards that apparently is against 5 man premades with a team of solos every single game and the premade is 3 ranked tiers above them, etc, etc. So then why would there be a problem? The track record for ranked is that most people queueing up for support are not queueing alone. As a support main I can tell you that there is no way in hell I will queue for support solo. This community in-game is 100% prepared to throw anyone but themselves under the bus, with support and jungle as the 2 main targets, if you're brave enough to queue as support in a purely solo scenario knowing that most people sub diamond are just there to stroke their egos and get a lot of kills and fancy plays then be my guest, I'd much rather have Dynamic Queue so I can know that at least the ENTIRE team won't be reporting me because I am literally unable to stop my carry from diving into the entire enemy team with reckless abandon.

Sure, some support players would still prefer a purely solo queue like back in the old days of the first ranked season, but how many do you think that's really going to be? If you think queue times are long now oh buddy, when I first started ranked people were about ready to trace somebody's IP and shoot up their house before they would willingly go support with randoms. Queues now are like 5 minutes tops if you queue for purely carry roles, At a low-ball guess I'd say that in pure solo you'd be looking at like 15 minute queues if there was still pre-game role selection because you know how Riot hates the meta changing from 1/1/2 lanes with a jungler, and without role selection beforehand all the raging comes back and suddenly the support role is back to being "The poor guy who got stuck with 5th pick".

If solo queue gets added then sweet, more people get what they want, fine by me, but on the other hand the potential for Riot to waste a lot of time getting the separated ranked stats going, having multiple ranked queues going at once trying to match people together at a similar skill level in a way that feels rewarding to players beyond just winning a game for it to just flop because of the unpopularity of the support role leading to its eventual removal again (hi Dominion) is something perfectly reasonable to be worried about. At the end of the day people want Solo queue to be ranked and competitive, just like the solo/quo queue was, and now Dynamic Queue, they want it taken seriously, and Riot is afraid that it will flop and be a waste of time, effort, and money trying to make it what people want.

But what do they do in the more likely case that neither solo queue nor dynamic queue are significantly more popular than the other, but they're both taking enough away from each other that neither of them are as popular as they need to be? Long queue times for both, etc.

I don't think Riot care as much about dynamic queue as everyone is saying, though I think they feel it's a better option than solo queue if one had to be chosen. I think what they're most concerned about is if both of them will kill each other should they coexist. If solo queue came out and dynamic queue instantly died then I imagine Riot would be fine with that and just get rid of dynamic queue, but I don't think that's the scenario they fear.

> [{quoted}](name=OhWanderer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wlEIEI9x,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-03-23T17:55:05.084+0000)
>
> this player base is literally so huge that that couldnt happen. It would go one way or the other.

I don't think that is the case. Queue times are decently long as is right now despite how many players we have and that's especially true for people who select exclusively carry roles - there's a reason people complain that if you don't pick Fill or Support, you end up being punished with eternal queue times. Given how big an issue this is already, exacerbating it by splitting the playerbase in half is dangerous. You are talking significant queue time extensions to everything except support because... how could there not be extensions?

I don't see it going one way or the other either, unless people are massively overestimating the popularity of solo queue and it's going to heavily lean towards dynamic. Too many people enjoy playing in premades for solo queue to ever take up a vast majority of the ranked playerbase (especially with team 5s incorporated into dynamic queue) and so the coexistence of the two queues can only result in them both taking up a decent chunk of the playerbase (resulting in extended queue times for both) or dynamic queue winning outright (resulting in massive solo queue waits and probably eventual deletion).

I don't massively care which queue ends up being the dominant one but I think Riot is correct to worry about the impact that introducing solo queue would have. If it was popular enough to contend with dynamic queue but not popular enough to flat out replace it then queue times would be a lot worse and matchmaking would be worsened on top of that. And if it wasn't popular then it would just be a failure, obviously. I think a lot of the people most passionately campaigning about solo queue haven't really thought about the potential consequences of adding it (i.e. they haven't thought that something might be worrying Riot beyond "oh no, our precious dynamic queue!") and I also think there is a fool's paradise of sorts present here where people are assuming the situation is much more heavily in their favour than it may well be ("EVERYONE wants solo queue, EVERYONE is comfortable with never playing a premade game in ranked again!" - how confident can you be in this statement?).

It is something that needs careful consideration. That Riot decided to take the time to consider it *after* they announced that solo queue would come back is ridiculous and a huge mistake on their part but the consideration itself is necessary. You can't just assume that everything would work out perfectly.

It's not a better option though. It makes the ranked ladder watered down in a "Competitive" game. There was already normal games to play with your friends and even a team ranked to get a ranked game with friends of all skill levels.

It wasn't broken and Riot went and made it broken by forcing us to play a way half the people didn't want to play in the first place. I think it's fair to say the majority of players play ranked solo, why even bother putting in premades like 3 or 4 queues that force solo players in their games. It's silly to be honest. They need to make a dynamic queue where 2's and 3's pair together and 5's and leave solo's to solo queue with their own ranking system.

> [{quoted}](name=CuteGuy6pack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wlEIEI9x,comment-id=00030002,timestamp=2016-03-23T21:11:41.223+0000)

I think it's fair to say the majority of players play ranked solo, why even bother putting in premades like 3 or 4 queues that force solo players in their games. It's silly to be honest. They need to make a dynamic queue where 2's and 3's pair together and 5's and leave solo's to solo queue with their own ranking system.

Personal opinions in terms of which is the better mode aside, I am not really willing to assume that most ranked players are solo. I think last year it would have been easier to assume whether solos or duos were more popular (I reckon solo) but it's a very different queue now, with a lot more flexibility for people who want to play together for one thing. So it's really impossible for us to assess the situation with as little information as we have. Frankly I'm not sure Riot can even make a conclusive judgment with the data *they* have, but if I had to trust someone between myself and them to decide which one the playerbase is best off with, I'd trust them. They know more than us and there's no particular incentive for them to be biased towards one mode over the other. Realistically, "we don't like to be proven wrong" isn't a reasonable motivation for a business and while that hasn't necessarily stopped businesses in the past, one would expect people to learn from their mistakes.

It is a big deal for people who *only* liked playing ranked solely for the competitive aspect of it that is watered down in dynamic queue, so I do hope Riot decides that solo queue can viably be released. At the same time, I just don't feel comfortable saying we should just replace dynamic queue with it when it could well be a highly successful queue despite the controversy. Really what I'd most like from Riot is data on the issue. They've only provided very small amounts and that can easily be construed as them having something to hide.
